Texto: 
high fever
obtundation
surgical drainage and antibiotics
• extensive chronic sinusitis
• subdural collections in inter-hemispheric fissure and overlying right frontal lobe.
• fluid has restricted diffusion noted on dwi and adc maps
subdural empyema, streptococcus mitis
• subdural hematoma
• subdural effusion
• metastatic disease
• sarcoid
14 year old boy with a history of chronic sinusitis. presents with high fever, seizures, and obtundation
interhispheric and convexity subdural empyema secondary to chronic frontal sinusitis.  the culture of pus grew out streptococcus mitis. 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/streptococcus_mitis
